newsitem.title: USA: U.S. consumer incomes, spending up in January.
newsitem.headline: U.S. consumer incomes, spending up in January.

text.p: American consumers increased their spending briskly in January as personal incomes kept growing, the Commerce Department said on Monday, adding momentum to the economy's expansion as 1997 began.

Spending increased 0.7 percent to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of $5.3 trillion -- the strongest pickup in monthly spending since a 0.9 percent gain last October -- after a slim 0.2 percent December rise.
Incomes from wages, salaries and all other sources rose 0.3 percent to $6.65 trillion following a 0.7 percent December increase.
